intro: Polytoma inodora, commonly known as the sweet sarsapilla, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in arid environments.
